Literature Review: Generative models have become a cornerstone of various disciplines, from statistics to molecular biology, particle physics, and epidemiology. These models have the ability to link conceptual theories with observed data, providing a powerful tool for reasoning in complex situations. In this literature review, we will explore the probabilistic and computational concepts underlying modern generative models, their applications in experimental design, iterative model refinement, goodness-of-fit evaluation, and agent-based simulation, and discuss opportunities for interdisciplinary research.
